name: Marc Andreessen
tweet: Now feels like the perfect time to fully express my views on a bunch of highly controversial topics! 1/57

tweet: https://t.co/IlRYdH6610

name: Marc Andreessen
tweet: And finally  https://t.co/VaYYE21E2d ‚ÄúAn Apology For The Builder‚Äù by Nicholas Barbon, written in 1685. HT @tylercowen. Some things never change!

name: Marc Andreessen
tweet: https://t.co/iMnL6ZAawy by @ConorDougherty on why we can't build in great American cities like San Francisco today and what we need to do about it.

name: Marc Andreessen
tweet: https://t.co/a1SzZloNIN by Edward Glaeser @triumphofcity on the central role cities play in our world and why it's so important for us to build them -- more, bigger, better.

name: Marc Andreessen
tweet: https://t.co/SEP8lKsEhc by Edmund Morris on perhaps the greatest American builder of all, the builder who brought electricity to us all, Thomas Edison.

name: Marc Andreessen
tweet: https://t.co/6SyHCEdwCA by Charles Morris on how four great builders of the 19th century built the world we live in today.

name: Marc Andreessen
tweet: https://t.co/FMWXatz2Mu by George Gilder @ScandalOfMoney on how economic systems that encourage aggressive entrepreneurship build the most for the benefit of the most.

name: Marc Andreessen
tweet: https://t.co/0rxb8x8uGs by William Lewis on how technology-driven productivity growth improves human welfare and creates more jobs and higher wages.

name: Marc Andreessen
tweet: https://t.co/UPHA24DBVf by @amcafee on how modern technological economies can build more outputs with less inputs, and why we need all economies to be modern and technological.

name: Marc Andreessen
tweet: https://t.co/gt6oFCeIFN by @stewartbrand on why even environmentalists should be pro building, pro cities, pro nuclear, and pro genetic engineering.
